name: The Atlantic Resort & Spa

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Atlantic prior to a cruise in May. Everything about the hotel was excellent from the easy check-in to our beautiful ocean view room. Absolutely no complaints. We had very positive experience and we'll be back in October for another pre-cruise stay!!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel stay !!

reviews.text: My wife, infant, and I stayed at the Atlantic for five nights the first week of June on a Starwood Preferred Guest Award. Right from the beginning this hotel was absolutely fantastic. I do a lot of business travel, and usually stay at Sheraton, Westin, Marriott, Hyatt, etc.. This hotel was definitely one notch up, on par with a Four Seasons, or Ritz Calton. I would go as far as to say it was the second nicest hotel I've been at, behind the Four Seasons in Maui.
reviews.title: Beautiful Luxury Hotel with Top of Class Service

reviews.text: We pleasantly found out that we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom Deluxe suite! This room (about 800 sq ft) was on the 10th floor (wonderful view). The going rate for this room was about $849 p/n. The rooms had all of the luxuries you would expect. Gilchrist & Soames amenities, plush towels, robes, in-room safe, huge marble bath, small kitchen, all with granite counter tops. The bed was the Heavenly Bed, and the shower was the best I have ever had. The room had two big flat screen TV's, a Bose Waveradio bedside, with a Bose Stereo System in the LR. The rooms also had evening turndown/towel/cleanup service. The room was spotless. There were no beat up furniture, or walls, or stains. This room was pristine.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel! We will definitely return
excellent hotel
reviews.text: We reserved a crib, and it was very nice for our infant. It was a real crib, with a very good mattress, and bumpers on the sides. It also came with a soft warm blanket for the baby.

The service was the best. We had multiple requests during our stay, extra towels, clean up etc.. They were very prompt in our requests, and never let us down. The management was constantly seeking feedback on our experience with the hotel. They were extremely attentive to details and service.
reviews.title: Loved It.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all of the excellent reviews, I decided to take my girlfriend to The Atlantic Resort & Spa for her birthday and spend one night on the beach in Ft. Lauderdale instead of the Ritz right down the street. I was less than overwhelmed to say the least. The front desk girl was less than interested to have us there and was just doing her job checking us in. I admit that we arrived early and they gave us a room but, make me feel like you care. We stayed in an oceanfront suite and it was nice but, not what I read about. The wallpaper was peeling off of the walls in the bathroom, there was only one robe for two people and there was water pouring in from the room upstairs into the bathtub. Engineering came to look at it and after going upstairs to see what the issue was, the light above the bathtub was left apart. Needless to say, she did not use the tub. The shower was excellent and the hotel staff did leave us with a very nice birthday surprise of cupcakes. The concierge, through our travel agent, was supposed to make reservations at Casa DeAngelos but, when we arrived, there was none. (Excellent restaurant by the way). Finally, we booked through our Virtuoso travel agent which gave us a free breakfast and $100 spa credit. I had to ask for it when checking in and was told the $100 would be credited to my bill at checkout. It was not and as for the continental breakfast, it was horrible. The breads were stale and the eggs were sitting there forever and tasted as such. I see no reason why I would ever return here and expected much more from this type of hotel.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has it all for a great weekend away, my husband and I stayed for the Columbus Day weekend and although the weather was horrible (torrential rains) we had plenty to do, and the hotel helped us make the best of a wet weekend. From arrival at the front desk to the help from Janete and Sheryl at the conceirge desk before and during that weekend what a great team. The rooms are the cleanest I have ever stayed at, and the location across from the beach is great. Spa treatment was wonderful, and just the use of the spa alone with the sauna and steam area. They all make sure your stay is relaxing and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Restful Getaway

reviews.text: We will be back and hopefully the weather will cooperate next time. Thank you to all the staff including the pool bar personnel they were so accommadating! The only tip I would suggest is having a rental vehicle so you can check out resturants outside walking distance.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAY!

reviews.text: I originally booked an ocean view suite and prepaid. I contacted the hotel to let them know we would be a late arrival. When we arrived, they had sold our suite, so no room with a view. At first, I was disappointed, but the suite they put us in had a large balcony, much larger than most of the suites and the suite itself was huge! They offered to move us the next day, but we really liked the upgrade, so we chose to stay put. Staff warm and friendly. I'm not sure who the young man was I spoke with about our late arrival, but he did us a favor by not passing the information on.
reviews.title: I'll Be Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at The Atlantic for a long weekend at the beginning of October. I'm a Starwood Gold and Hilton Diamond member so it took a lot for me to skip the W and the Hilton and book The Atlantic - but I'm so glad I did. From the moment I arrived, I felt that this place would be different. I was right. The bellmen were friendly and efficient and the Front Desk personnel couldn't have been more welcoming. I was shown to my room and I was very happy with the decor, the location and the fantastic view of the beach. Having the kitchen was such a bonus, allowing me to enjoy the restaurants in the hotel and nearby while taking care of my own breakfast on the balcony. I spent a long, relaxing weekend at the Atlantic before heading out to a week of crazy SoBe partying. The Atlantic and I will meet again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort, had a great time.

reviews.text: First, I really liked the hotel and had a very nice stay. Howver, there were a few things that made it miss the mark for me for a really top level hotel.
reviews.title: Great room, service is slightly uncoordinated

likes.liked: — room was amazing and ocean views

reviews.text: When I arrived, they said they had upgraded me to an ocean view suite (hurray!) but that the room wasn't quite ready. The desk clerk said they needed housekeeping to do a "walk through" and it would be just a minute. She would come and get me when the room was ready. She walked me over to a couch in the lobby, was super attentive, and I was thinking, "wow, this is a good sign!"
reviews.title: Aging Fast

likes.disliked: — Cold Feeling of Lobby and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I sat in the lobby and after 10 minutes, I went up and told her I was going to the bar to get a drink while I waited. The other desk clerk looks up and says, "oh, here's her keys" and hands her the package that was laying on the counter. She doesn't appologize or explain. And who knows, maybe it was just completed that very second...
reviews.title: A Disappointment

likes.liked: — The beautiful rooms, and the great service whenever we needed something taken up to our room (toothpaste, and bandaids)
likes.disliked: — The over priced hidden fees, dirty public beach with no hotel chairs, and thin walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I confirm that breakfast is included in the rate, that I want a late checkout, and I've just gotten off a long flight and I'm going to nap before I have to go out that evening so I don't want to be disturbed, etc. All confirmed, no problem, in your record...
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the hotel is completely dead, it's not like they are dealing with a rush. Apparently lots of people cancelled out because of a hurricane warning during the week. There is no one in the lobby and no one checked in the entire time I was waiting.
reviews.title: Great Place To Relax

reviews.text: Was here for three days - this is the first of the new breed of combination hotel/ownership scheme on Ft. Lauderdale beach. There is a Trump, Hilton, W and St. Regis in various stages of construction on the same road. If you want to enjoy the area before the masses descend, this is probably the last season to do it.
reviews.title: Great in every way that matters

likes.liked: — Location, level of service and comfort.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: The Atlantic belongs to the Luxury Collection in SPG so I feel compelled to judge it based on those standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were uniformly excellent, well trained, friendly, willing to help, always moving out of the way for guests in hallways, elevators etc. I had a one bedroom suite with a decent ocean view. The bed was comfortable with high quality linen. There was a kitchenette with a two burner stove, microwave, all utensils for cooking and eating but just a small fridge which was full of mini bar items, no room for anything else. The fridge did have an icemaker which was great. There was a Bose DVD player with radio with a Bose speaker system in the living room of my suite, along with a bose radio in the bedroom. The bathroom was large and well appointed, with very thick towels. When I got to my room there was all the fixings for an exotic martini drink, including two bottles of premium vodka and a shaker as a welcome. Very nice.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!

likes.liked: — First class facilities and genuinely friendly staff attitude

reviews.text: The pool is on the fifth floor, the pool area is broken up into two areas. The beach chairs are practically on top of each other in most areas, the pool is adequate though. The pool area is fully wheelchair accessible including the bathrooms, which even have a shower that is accessible. The exercise room is near the pool area, also very well equipped.
reviews.title: Luxury on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are only two elevators, I can imagine this presenting a bit of a problem at peak occupancy.
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.text: After a bad experience at a different location, we checked in at the Atlantic. Night and day. The lobby is very nice, the front desk personnel were very welcoming and were able to provide us with all of the amenities of the hotel, and the room was incredible. It is in the middle of the resort area so everything is steps away if you don't want to pull the car out every time you want to do something and to be honest if you don't want to do anything else they have everything here. And you are just across the street from a beautiful beach. Did not dine there so I am not sure how the restaurants are, although I read a review that was so-so. I'd definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, wonderful spa, and made you feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just left the Atlantic Hotel after spending a great 2 days there. We live local, so we had the choice of many hotels on both Miami and Ft. Lauderdale beaches. There were 2 great aspects, The Spa and the service, especially the concierge team of Janete and Sheryl. WOW!!
reviews.title: Our 25th Anniversary

reviews.text: They were great in helping me plan out a surprise for my wife and when the weather went bad, they were there again to "save the day".
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Our room was beautiful, the ocean view is awesome, you feel like you are on a ship. There is absolutely no sight of the street or any sound from it. If you want a first class facility with a first class staff, stay at the Atlantic and say "HEY" to those great ladies!
reviews.title: Relaxing, Refreshing and Restful!

reviews.text: Reasonable priced for this location. Good service and amenities. If you're looking for a nice place to stay in Ft Lauderdale and not pay a king's ransom, this is the place. The conciegre was most helpful. We were in town for the boat show and she made all of arrangements without a flaw.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutly true to description, the rooms perfect size well appointed , ocean views and mine also provided me with a great sunset. Bellmen , concierge , front desk personel all on top of their game. The pool has a slendid view and with Chris attending the bar you get friendly dedicated service. Rooms are extremely quiet, which for me is a must, the kitchenette is a real convenience but does not take away the luxury feel. I will without hesitation stay at this hotel again . I am not giving a 5 stars for the following reasons : renovations in the restaurant which took away the full enjoyement from pool area , then a photo shoot going on in the fitness center, and like most tv people were rude thinking the space were theres and in fact they should have been a little more yielding to the Paying Guest. The gym is extremely attractive so i left frustrated because they acted very disrespectful of the guests and i dont care who they are, and they rubbed me the wrong way i say because i know arrogance from professinalism. I got annoyed by their behavior when i was enjoying the perfect stay. Its life i guess. In any case overall very satisfactory, tastful, discret elegance, soft bedding , a true gem of this gorgeous part of the coast.
reviews.title: A solid value in fort lauderdale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am sad to say this hotel has gone down hill since my last visit. It used to be one of my favourites. The hotel restaurant is closed for renovations, so my ocean view breakfast was no longer an option. It would have been nice to have this tidbit of information before I booked. The pool side bar is closed because there is a wedding in progress. The once friendly and helpful staff are no longer in attendance. The lobby once filled with fresh flowers and the scent of citrus is a distant memory. To top it all off we have a very depressing view of the empty and forclosed Trump Condo Tower that was never quite finished. The lack of service and amenities should downgrade this property to a 3 star.
reviews.title: Not what it used to be.......

reviews.text: This hotel is a very attractive modernized hotel on the ocean front of Fort Lauderdale. A colleague and I were travelling on business to FL and needed a central location with some luxury options. Our rooms were clean, updated, spacious, and beautifully appointed, as was the luxe bathroom. It is a peaceful, muted, and tasteful option on the otherwise garish beachfront.
reviews.title: it was just what i needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was as helpful as could be, from the bellmen/valets, front desk, and concierge. The concierge went out of her way to make us some nice dinner reservations, and then had the restaurant throw in a free glass of wine at one and a desert at the other. The front desk quickly arranged for an early check in and late check out which made my life much easier, and the valets were very accommodating with my rental car and luggage needs.
reviews.title: Hotel still as good as ever

reviews.text: The hotel fronts on the beach across the street, and that is really very nice. Good people watching on the very nice beach, well patrolled, life guards, etc.
reviews.title: Wish there were more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing special about this hotel - very similar to any other high-rise property that sits along A1A except, of course, that it is brand spanking new. Location is decent as it is right across the street from the beach but keep in mind this is not a family hotel - this is more like a W so expect hip, young singles that are 30 something and the deck waitresses to strut around like they are on a catwalk.
reviews.title: Nice - but nothing special

likes.disliked: — Where am I again...the W? The Westin?

reviews.title: Top Notch!
reviews.text: Service was good overall. The workout facilities are TINY given the size of this hotel. Parking was VERY expensive.

This hotel was outstanding. I had the opportunity to stay here several months ago & every aspect of my trip was top notch from the service to room quality. i would recommend this hotel to business travelers & leisure travelers alike. I cant wait for my next stay here!
reviews.title: A wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: My brother and I stayed in the Atlantic Hotel for 2 days. It is a luxury jewel ideally located on Fort Lauderdale. Our room was huge and beautifully appointed. Our bathroom was impressive and had the most amazing shower. The room was quiet and we had a view of the Ocean. The Pool and the view from there were spectacular. Room service could not be better, we were treated like royalty from the first day to the last. This last trip was my fifth visit to Fort Lauderdale and the first time I have stayed at the Atlantic Hotel. It is the cleanest and most comfortable hotel that I have stayed anywhere. The location is fantastic!!. The Atlantic Hotel provided the perfect haven for us after a long day of touring. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. I could not have asked for more in a hotel. Thanks to the Atlantic Hotel and the wonderful staff there.
reviews.title: What a fantastic property!

reviews.text: I stayed two nights at the Atlantic in Ft. Lauderdale recently. It was one of the most beautfiul properties I've stayed at in Florida. The room was wonderfully appointed with all amenities and the staff was very courteous and attentive. And with all the rooms having a partial or full view of the ocean, it's just perfect!
reviews.title: Ready To Go Back To The Atlantic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent two nights at The Atlantic to end a weeklong vacation in Florida. We looked forward to the stay all week after booking one of the hotel's more expensive King Oceanfront suites. While the room, bathroom, and view were all lovely, we found it difficult to enjoy them. When we checked in the front desk staff did not inform us the pool would be closed at 3pm on both Friday AND Saturday due to private events. They also neglected to inform us the private events were weddings, including DJs and sound systems, taking place on the pool deck just a few floors below the room and balcony we spent quite a bit of money to enjoy. Rather than leaving the sliders open to enjoy the fresh air and ocean sounds we had to close them dull the noise from below both nights until 10-11pm. It's outrageous that a hotel would not notify guests of the situation and give them the option of moving to a room in another location. In addition to the noise below our room, we had a door adjoining the room next door that provided absolutely no soundproofing. We could clearly hear the loud conversations of the three or four 20-something young ladies both during the day (even from the bathtub) as well as at 2:00am when they returned from a night of drinking at the bars. We called to complain about both of these issues and were told the hotel was booked and we could not be moved. We certainly were not offered any other type of compensation and our stay at The Atlantic was a disappointing one. We certainly did not get the romantic and relaxing experience we paid for.
reviews.title: Not the romantic getaway we hoped for...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed a quick get away for our anniversary at the Atlantic and loved it! We stayed in an ocean front room, the room was quite large and very comfortable. As others have noted the bathroom was gorgeous with quite possibly the greatest shower that I have ever experienced in my life. We also enjoyed the balcony which looked out upon the beach and the ocean across the street. I also have to mention the staff, as they were among the friendliest and most pleasant that we have ever encountered. So after all these accolades you may be wondering why I only rated the Atlantic very good instead of excellent, it is due to the pigeons in the pool area. Never have I seen such aggressive birds, one went so far as to try and land on a man's shoulder while he ate lunch at the pool bar. You had to be careful not to sit or lean on bird poop when sitting by the bar (I learned this the hard way). Also the birds were landing in the pool as well as on the surfaces in the food prep areas. Not sure if there is anything that a hotel can do about pigeons in an outdoor area but it ruined the pool bar for us. We were planning on enjoying happy hour there on our last night but couldn't take the birds literally landing on the bar right next to us. Only other complaint would be that we found the breakfast to be pricey (it is the only meal that we ate in the hotel restaurant) but loved the hotel bar in the evening. Again, great staff and service (thanks Helen!) and a delicious appitizer (Butternut Squash Wontons). We would not hesitate to go back to the Atlantic and will probably make it our first choice when planning our next trip to Ft. Lauderdale but will not eat at the pool if the birds are still a problem.
reviews.title: Great spot, great service, great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Atlantic Hotel for our honeymoon and all we can say is wow! The service was exceptional from the moment we arrived on the premises. Both our valet Jeff and Justin at the front desk were great all week! Our concierge Janete gave great restaurant and activity suggestions, and helped our honeymoon to end on a high note by arranging for a reservation at one of the best area restaurants. The accommodations are first class and we are definitely looking forward to returning for an anniversary trip!
reviews.title: Our honeymoon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I decided that we would try Fort Lauderdale and found the Atlantic Resort and Spa via Trip Advisor. We arrived on Thursday 10/20 and Stayed for 5 great days. After booking an ocean front room after careful review of all the pictures, I was so surpised upon our arrival that our room and the views were so spectacular (better then any pictures). We rented a car with plans to drive to Naples, but because of this great hotel we only took a day trip to Miami. The Beach is great and not crowed at all. The Service is great. We decided to stay at the hotel on my birthday Saturday and had great music because of the Wedding Reception at the pool just below our room. The only bad thing is I didn't want to Leave. Hoping to make the trip next year again (or sooner)
reviews.title: Best 50th Birthday Get Away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved this hotel. Our room was huge, spacious, extremely clean, new, just wow! The cleaning staff very meticulous. The desk staff awesome. The Concierge right on with his suggestions. The spa offers great services. We enjoyed massage and pedicures. The pool, divine! I cant say enough about this hotel. I will be back, without a doubt!!
reviews.title: They had me at hello!

description: Designed for the discerning traveler, the resort is devoted to the pursuit of service and elegance, affording the perfect balance for business and pleasure. Recreationally speaking: The hotel is situated across from Fort Lauderdale's Blue Wave Beach, our full-service Spa,lap pool and fifth floor sun deck overlooking the ocean are indeed relaxing.
